definition: self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Both drives him to become an extreme egoist.
sentences.chinese: 两者驱使他成为一个极端的利己主义者。

sentences.english: The participant's behaviour can be explained by simple economic self-interest.
sentences.chinese: 被试的行为可以通过经济上的利己主义来解释。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the national egoism had also been expanded and developed viciously.
sentences.chinese: 但同时苏联的民族利己主义也出现了恶性的膨胀发展。
这是一个彻头彻尾的利己主义者。

sentences.english: There remains as a third category the intolerance caused by self-interest.
sentences.chinese: 利己主义还可带来第三种的“不容忍”。

sentences.english: Japanese politics is tainted with egoism and populism.
sentences.chinese: 日本政治带有利己主义和民粹主义的风气。

sentences.english: People shelve the out - of - fashion moral icon and espouse the philosophy of egoism.
sentences.chinese: 搁置了人民的时尚图标和拥护道德哲学的利己主义。

sentences.english: So over time, we're moving towards a much more individualistic society.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们将步入更加利己主义的社会。

sentences.english: Is their financial self-interest truly aligned with mine as a shareholder?
sentences.chinese: 他们的金融利己主义是我们股东是站在一条线上的吗？
我是顽固的利己主义者。

definition: everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary

pinyin: she4 hui4 Da2 er3 wen2 zhu3 yi4
